intro: Preserve the dark sky and open space. We find verified contractors for acreage-scale hardscapes, drought-tolerant landscaping, and outdoor kitchens.
neighborhoodDescription: Known as the 'Gateway to the Hill Country', Dripping Springs is defined by larger acreage lots and dark-sky ordinances. Whether you're in a master-planned community like Belterra or on a private ranch, projects here need to respect the natural environment. Our pros are well-versed in low-impact development and acreage management.
serviceAreaOverview: Serving Dripping Springs, Driftwood, and the surrounding ranch lands.

climateChallenges.title: Dark Sky Compliance
climateChallenges.description: Outdoor lighting must meet strict local ordinances to preserve the night sky. The lighting specialists we recommend design down-lit, warm-spectrum systems that enhance safety without pollution.

climateChallenges.title: Acreage Drainage
climateChallenges.description: Managing water runoff on large lots is critical to prevent erosion. We connect you with experts in berms, swales, and large-scale land grading.

climateChallenges.title: Caliche & Rocky Soil
climateChallenges.description: Planting in white limestone clay (caliche) is tough. Our partners source native plants specifically adapted to alkaline soils and limited water availability.

marketInsights.title: Dripping Springs Specialist Focus
marketInsights.description: Finding contractors willing to travel to acreage properties or who understand septic-safe landscaping can be tough. Our network is curated with rural-ready pros who specialize in large-format hardscaping, deer fencing, and sustainable land stewardship.
